spec.function_description: Assemble a component into an assembly
notes: If you are running Creo 7 or higher, you must call creo:set_creo_version to set the Creo version

request.name: generic
request.description: Generic model name (if file name represents an instance)

request.name: path
request.description: Path to a component that the new part will be constrained to

request.name: ref_model
request.description: Reference model that the new part will be constrained to; only used if path is not given.  If there are multiple of this model in the assembly, the component will be assembled multiple times, once to each occurrence

request.name: transform
request.description: Transform structure for the initial position and orientation of the new component; only used if there are no constraints, or for certain constraint types

request.name: package_assembly
request.description: Whether to package the component to the assembly; only used if there are no constraints specified
request.default: If there are no constraints, then the user will be prompted to constrain the component through the Creo user interface

request.name: walk_children
request.description: Whether to walk into subassemblies to find reference models to constrain to

request.name: assemble_to_root
request.description: Whether to always assemble to the root assembly, or assemble to the subassembly containing the reference path/model

request.name: suppress
request.description: Whether to suppress the components immediately after assembling them

response.name: revision
response.description: Revision of file that was opened; if more than one file was opened, this field is not returned

response.name: featureid
response.description: Last Feature ID of component after assembly
